parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To read, know again, know certainly, recognize, discern. From ana and ginosko; to know again, i.e. to read.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To interrogate, question, demand of. From epi and erotao; to ask for, i.e. Inquire, seek.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Genitive Feminine Singular
str2: Of what sort. From the base of pou and hoios; individualizing interrogative what sort of, or which one.
Sphere of duty, province. From a compound of epi and archo; a special region of government, i.e. A Roman pr?Fecture.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To ask, inquire, ascertain by inquiry, understand.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
Probably of foreign origin; Cilicia, a region of Asia Minor.
